reviewText: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my fiance. He watched all of them in 2 days -facepalm- But he loved them and wants me to buy more. Which I will do in the future...if he is good ^_^

On a whim (and because of the low price), I bought both of The Dragon Dynasty four film box sets. I think I like Volume 2 much better than this because those films are much more serious in tone. I am new to Shaw Bros. films so I don't have much to compare these with. I enjoyed them all for the most part except Five Shaolin Masters which I found incredibly boring. The other three films lean heavily towards the comedic side of things and will appeal to those of us whose know martial arts cinema mostly from Jackie Chan.
awesome collection,  I have watched thiz set many many times...  recommend more for me
I just love the multi packs of movies.  This gave me the opportunity to watch more martial arts shows without having to switch dvd's. all I can say is keep doing the multi's.

Great movie compilation as compared to other Dragon Dynasty boxed sets.  Every movie in the set is classic!  Lau Kar-leung directs three of the movies here and 'Five Shoalin Masters' directed by Chang Cheh . . . OH YEAH!!

Gave as Christmas gift to a family. Not all of the movies had the best story lines, but stilo good for family nite or passing time. Not sure how die hard collector would feel, unless they collect a particular actor or theme.
this was a good part of someones christmas gift without have to go broke buying it, just added a little something else.

Overall I can't complain about the production value.  They have been re-mastered and the work was good.  The language options page is easy to use and the English version seems better than most movies.  No long screams to fill in words.

Story line and action wise is another matter.  I will list each movie separately

Martial Arts Of Shaolin;  It has a very young Jet Li as the main character.  He has to be young he never would have agreed to do this after he was established.  His Shaolin monk character eats meat is obsessed with revenge, has a silver bracelet that he has had since he was a baby and is teaching a gang of urchins kung-fu.  Any one of these would have been unbelievable adding them altogether was just hilarious.  As a saving grace though, the Martial action in this movie was pretty good.

Five Shaolin Masters;  Story line was at least believable.  The packaging calls this "one of the best cinematic displays of martial arts ever"  I disagree, I thought the fights were way to slow and the styles way to rigid.  The weapons were interesting but they seemed way to powerful.

Executioners of Shaolin;  This was enjoyable.  Believable (well more believable) plot line and the action was well choreographed.

Mad Monkey Kung Fu; Ok I have to admit I enjoyed this.  Couple of big mistakes in the overall plot.  But if you just shrug it off and enjoy the story as presented its pretty good.
Four Great Shaw Brothers movies for a low price. I paid maybe 5 bucks. They cost that much separately. If you are new to the Shaw Brothers name this is a great start.

Quality of the movie was not that great. I love Karate movies. I was disappointed in the quality of this product. I own other movies and the movies I have are good that why I got more from this series, but these movies were awful!

I'd been looking at a couple of the movies for individual purchase and then ran across this box set - JACKPOT! Great movies at a price you just can't beat!
This Kung Fu 4pk Box Set is an absolute must for Jet Li fans , and anyone else who enjoys authentic Kung Fu movies.

Four terrific films, each one a must-have for any kung fu cinema collector. All of them are great films and Dragon Dynasty does not let you down in terms of mastering and presentation. The films look and sound perfect -- could not ask for anything better in terms of viewing quality.

There isn't much in the way of special features here. Unlike many Dragon Dynasty releases there are no featurettes or Logan Bey commentary (this is what kept me from giving it five stars). But there are good language choices and having four films of such caliber in one set is well worth the Amazon price. If you're on the fence about this one, my advice is to buy with confidence.
this is a good add to a kung fu movie collection and it doesn't cost much. the packaging it comes in is good and the audio video quality is way better than the originals that came on tv and vhs
